name: Opentrons
headline: We make robots for biologists.
description:
Today, biologists spend too much time pipetting by hand. We think biologists should have robots to do pipetting for them. People doing science should be free of tedious benchwork and repetitive stress injuries. They should be able to spend their time designing experiments and analyzing data.

That's why we started Opentrons.

We make robots for biologists. Our mission is to provide the scientific community with a common platform to easily share protocols and reproduce each other's results. Our robots automate experiments that would otherwise be done by hand, allowing our community to spend more time pursuing answers to some of the 21st centuryâ€™s most important questions.

founders.name: Nicholas Wagner

MS Analytical Finance - Lehigh University '08

# Lab automation robots built for the future
##### With modular design and intelligent software, the possibilities for innovation are limitless. How will you Flex it?
[Learn about Flex](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/robots/flex>)
# Lab automation robots built for the future
##### With modular design and intelligent software, the possibilities for innovation are limitless. How will you Flex it?
[Learn about Flex](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/robots/flex>)
## Bringing science and automation together
Intuitive automation for cutting-edge discoveries
  * ![Intuitive Easy Accessible 1](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Intuitive-Easy-Accessible-1.svg)
Automation for breakthrough science
With user-friendly software and extensive support, lab automation can be accessible to all.
  * ![Open](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Open-Flexible.svg)
Flexibility meets discovery
Unparalleled lab flexibility that adapts to your research needs for the freedom to explore tomorrowâ€™s science.
  * ![Radical Innovation](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Radical-Innovation.svg)
Grow your research, not your costs
Scale alongside your ambition with high-quality automation that wonâ€™t sacrifice performance.
  * ![Community 2](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Community-2.svg)
Together, weâ€™re innovators
Access our rich protocol library, no-code tools, and expert support to power your research.


![GIF 4 8706801519](http://opentrons.com)
### Run a protocol on Flex
Click through an interactive demo to see how easy running a protocol on the Opentrons Flex is.
[Schedule a Demo](http://opentrons.com/<https:/insights.opentrons.com/schedule-demo>)
![Time Saver](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Time-Saver.svg)

##### around the world

+ robots
##### in labs since 2015
## Save time and automate your applications
Modular configurations and protocol solutions for your workflows
![NGS](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/NGS.svg)
##### NGS
Automate library prep and pre-sequencing workflows using tagmentation or fragmentation chemistries.
[Shop workstation](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/products/opentrons-flex-ngs-workstation>)
![Proteomics](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Proteomics.svg)
##### Protein Purification
Automate small-scale protein purification using magnetic beads or dual flow chromatography columns.
[Shop workstation](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/products/opentrons-flex-magnetic-bead-protein-purification-workstation>)
![General Liquid Handling](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/General-Liquid-Handling.svg)
##### Walk-up Pipetting
Automate quick pipetting workflows like cherrypicking, normalization, and plate stamping in minutes, no code needed.
[Shop Flex Prep](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/products/opentrons-flex-prep>)
![Nucleic Acid](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Nucleic-Acid-Extraction.svg)
##### Nucleic Acid Extraction
Flex enables you to automate your nucleic acid isolation and purification workflows using any leading magnetic bead-based system on the market.
[Shop workstation](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/products/opentrons-flex-nucleic-acid-extraction-workstation>)
![PCR](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/PCR.svg)
##### PCR
Fully automate your PCR setup and thermocycling at the scale you need to increase efficiency, reduce errors, and save hands-on time.
[Shop workstation](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/products/opentrons-flex-pcr-workstation>)
![previous](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Chevron-left.svg) ![previous](https://opentrons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Chevron-right.svg)
Automating NGS
### Democratizing biology with the DAMP Lab
DAMP Lab in Boston empowers research labs from all over to scale their science with automation.
[Learn More](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/damp-lab>)
![Rita Chen from DAMP Lab](http://opentrons.com) [ Play video](http://opentrons.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/embed/fuxCkcPeodw?si=WWXkj-NWgjt1AzyQ&controls=0?autoplay=1&playsinline=1&color=white&iv_load_policy=3>)

Artificial Intelligence
### AI and autonomous experimentation
Researchers like Gabe Gomes at CMU are leveraging A.I. to automate scientific discovery
[Learn More](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/future-of-automation>)
![Gabe Gomes of CMU](http://opentrons.com) [ Play video](http://opentrons.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/embed/gn26w4odF9E?si=sQMeM8C_x17RRR67&controls=0?autoplay=1&playsinline=1&color=white&iv_load_policy=3>)

## Opentrons fits your workflow
Protocol options for all experience levels and requirements
  * [ ![image 4 1](http://opentrons.com) Protocol Designer  Build your own protocol with a few clicks, no code required. Start designing ](http://opentrons.com/<https:/designer.opentrons.com/>)
  * [ ![image 42](http://opentrons.com) Protocol Library  Find a verified protocol ready to plug and play. Learn more ](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/intro-to-protocol-library>)
  * [ ![image 43](http://opentrons.com) OpentronsAI  AI powered the most robust Python API for protocol development. Ever. Learn more ](http://opentrons.com/<https:/opentrons.com/ai>)
  * [ ![Frame 4](http://opentrons.com) Python API  Framework designed to make it easy to write automated biology lab protocols. View documentation ](http://opentrons.com/<https:/docs.opentrons.com/v2/>)

generated_description:
Opentrons is on a mission to revolutionize scientific research by making lab automation accessible and practical for biologists. Founded in 2014 and part of the Y Combinator Batch W16, the company is based in New York City and has grown to a team of 300 employees. The idea sparked from a simple truth: biologists spend too much of their valuable time on mundane tasks like pipetting. Opentrons believes that researchers should focus on designing experiments and analyzing results, rather than getting bogged down by repetitive benchwork.

At its core, Opentrons develops user-friendly robotic systems designed specifically for various laboratory functions, such as nucleic acid extraction, protein purification, and next-generation sequencing (NGS). Their products include flexible robots like the Opentrons Flex and the OT-2, both of which simplify complex workflows and reduce human error. They also offer software tools like the Protocol Designer and a comprehensive Library for users to share and access protocols.

With a focus on community engagement, Opentrons provides a shared platform for scientists, promoting collaboration and reproducibility of results. They aim to democratize access to advanced lab automation across institutions, regardless of budget constraintsâ€”a refreshing take in the often high-cost landscape of biotech tools.

Michael Seibel, a notable Y Combinator Group Partner, is part of their journey, steering the company toward sustainable growth. The company's approach combines modular design with intelligent software, allowing researchers to tailor their automation solutions to fit their specific needs. 

For scientists seeking to automate their workflows, Opentrons is a compelling choice, bringing innovation to the forefront while maintaining a strong focus on user experience and support.

For more information, you can visit [Opentrons' website](http://opentrons.com).
